item.title: About Me
item.description: Who Am I? My name is Ashraf and Iâ€™m a sophomore undergraduate currently pursuing a Computer Engineering Degree at the National University of Singapore (NUS). I am also an aspiring entrepreneur with a goal to create my own startup that can make the world a better place through innovative products for the masses! I have a strong passion in analyzing companies and strategizing possible angles for upscaling businesses.

item.title: Education
item.description: National University of Singapore (NUS) August 2020 - Present Bachelors of Engineering: Computer Engineering (Honours) Relevant Courses Skills Learnt Engineering Principles and Practice I & II C/C++, Robotics, Arduino, LiDAR, Programming Methodology C, Vim, Linux, Bash Data Structures and Algorithms C++ Digital Design Verilog Computer Organisation Assembly Language Software Engineering and Object-Oriented Programming Java, Git/GitHub Real-Time Operating Systems (in progress) Embedded Systems, C, Microcontroller programming, OS concepts, scheduling algorithms Signals and Systems (in progress) Fourier transform, sampling, signal reconstruction, filtering Design and Analysis of Algorithms (in progress) Framework for algorithm analysis Raffles Institution (RI) January 2012 - December 2017 Singapore-Cambridge General Certificate of Education Advanced Level Science Stream (Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, Economics)

item.title: Experiences
item.description: Internship SGInnovate Product Management Intern (May 2021 - Aug 2021) Produced new UI/UX designs for in-house talent acquisition platform STARS Performed product testing on fixes, enhancements, and depployments Evaluated features of platform based on user feedback and develop recommendations for improvement Programmed Python scripts to evaluate talent scores depending on experiences and education Crafted a 70-page in-depth user manual to guide new hires and users on how to use in-house talent acquisiition platform Project Coordinator Intern (Feb 2020 - Jun 2020)

item.title: Projects
item.description: ConTech A Command Line Interface (CLI) application for managing computing-related contacts. Optimised for use on the CLI, ConTech allows you to seamlessly add, edit, view, list, search, and import your contacts. ConTech aims to improve your efficiency at work, be it by cutting down the time required to look up for various usernames when working with colleagues, or by importing hundreds of contacts with just one simple command.

item.title: Contact Me
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows. Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.
